cz.melkamar.andruian.indexer.dao

Class PlaceDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.melkamar.andruian.indexer.dao.PlaceDAO

  • @Component
public class PlaceDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    A Data Access Object for retrieving Place objects indexed in the system.

      • deletePlacesOfDataDefIri

        public void deletePlacesOfDataDefIri(java.lang.String dataDefIri)
        Delete all places that are described by a particular data definition.
        Parameters:
        dataDefIri - The IRI of a andr:DataDef object for which to delete all matching places.

      • getAllPlaces

        Get all places of the given RDF class indexed in the system.
        Parameters:
        classUri - The IRI of a RDF class to search for.
        Returns:
        A list of Place representing the matching data.

      • getPlacesAroundPoint

        public java.util.List<Place> getPlacesAroundPoint(double latCoord,
                                                  double longCoord,
                                                  double radius)
        Get places inside an area defined by the coordinates.
        Parameters:
        latCoord - The latitude of the center of the area to search in.
        longCoord - The longitude of the center of the area to search in.
        radius - The radius from the center of the area to search in, in kilometers.
        Returns:
        A list of Place representing the matching data.

      • getPlacesAroundPointOfClass

                                                         double latCoord,

                                                         double radius)
        Get places inside an area defined by the coordinates, of a particular RDF class.
        Parameters:
        classUri - The IRI of a RDF class to search for.
        latCoord - The latitude of the center of the area to search in.
        longCoord - The longitude of the center of the area to search in.
        radius - The radius from the center of the area to search in, in kilometers.
        Returns:
        A list of Place representing the matching data.
